results.title: 'Screen It' 2013 [finalists and winning entries]
results.brief_description:
‘Screen It’ was Australia’s national film, animation and game making competition for school-aged students, run by ACMI for 16 years to 2019.

Designed to encourage imagination and inventiveness in primary and secondary school students, ‘Screen It’ fostered a new generation of young media makers.

In 2013 students were asked to create works responding to the theme “Connect”.

Witness first-hand the amazing winning entries of the 2013 ‘Screen It’ competition!’

results.title: Soldier Settlers
results.creator_credit: George Ogilvie, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
Willesee’s Australians portrays the stories of some of Australia’s heroes and heroines; some virtually unrecognised, others known as significant figures during their own lifetimes. Following World Wars 1 and 11 large parcels of Australian farming land were purchased, divided up into small blocks and given to returned soldiers by the Federal Government. Many of the young soldiers and their families who won the land were inexperienced, untrained and undercapitalised. This is the story of the Durkin family - their hopes, triumphs and struggles as they make the most of their new lifestyle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Ogilvie, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders

results.title: So help me God
results.brief_description: Filmed at Campbelltown Local Court, N.S.W. it follows a number of people from their interviews with a solicitor to appearance before senior magistrate Kevin Flack. Shows the enormous workload and dedication of Legal Aid Solicitors whoo are seen advising their clients. Produced by award-winning documentary maker, Jenny Brockie, the filming took six weeks in total and the makers had secured unprecedented access to Campbelltown local court. All the defendants who feature in this program gave their written consent to be filmed. They include: Heidi - a nineteen year old mother of two, who’s been charged with receiving stolen goods; Dean - a young man charged with trying to break into a tattoo shop and trying to steal a tattoo gun; Joy - a 46 year old woman whose relatives are trying to have her put into a place of care under the Inebriates Act; Marietta - who’s seeking an order to stop her ex-husband’s girlfriend from harrassing her; Robert and Sean - who both face possible jail terms for separate offences of break, enter and steal. We also meet the major legal players at Campbelltown, the Senior Magistrate, Kevin Flack, Legal Aid lawyer - Justin Hutchinson, some private solicitors and the Police Prosecutor.

results.title: Snub Music Magazine
results.brief_description: This is a compilation of the best and most recent English and European music clips shown on BBC Television. The bands represented are among the most innovative and progressive from the independent music scene. The clips combine an exciting and wide range of highly specialised visual effects. Intercut with the clips are interviews with various music industry people such as BBC disc jockey, John Peel. Bands included are Duritti Column, New Order, Gary Clail, M.A.R.R.S. and Algerian group - Fadela.

results.title: Private John Simpson
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
One of the greatest symbols of Australia at war is that of Private John Simpson and the Battle of Gallipoli. Simpson and his donkey “Duffy” were a familiar sight on the shores of Gallipoli as they worked day and night carrying wounded allied soldiers from the frontline to the beach. He was attributed with saving the lives of hundreds, his tenderness and concern for the wounded were renowned. His death was inevitable and he knew it. Private John Simpson and his donkey have gone down in history as a bastion of valour amidst a world at war.

results.title: Jack Davey
results.creator_credit: George Whaley, Film Australia, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
In 1954, radio personality Jack Davey was the most famous person in Australia. During the same year Jack entered the first around Australia car race, the Redex Trial. On the road in north Western Australia his car fell apart under the strain. He was disqualified from the race after taking a short cut and missing a checkpoint. Disillusioned but not defeated, Jack decided he was to be the first back in Sydney regardless of whether he was still in the race or not.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Whaley, Film Australia, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders

results.title: Clyde Fenton
results.creator_credit: John Power, Film Australia, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
Clyde Fenton was a skilled aviator and brilliant surgeon. Together with fellow doctor, Cecil Cook, the Northern Territories Chief Medical Officer, he pioneered the creation of the Flying Doctor Service. The Doctor Service was a great medical success but ran foul of the Department of Civil Aviation. Fenton battled with the Department and he soon found himself in court fighting for his right to fly and carry on with his work. Fenton soon became a folk hero to the people of the Northern Territory.

results.title: Snowbirds
results.creator_credit: Michael Brun, National Film Board of Canada and Nimbus Film Productions
results.brief_description: From cockpit to ground to sky, the camera follows the spectacular aerobatics of the Canadian Forces Air Demonstration team who control their 9.7 m long, single-engine jets as if they were extensions of their own bodies. During practice sessions, their maneuvers are videotaped for the pilots’ viewing and subsequent correction. Narrated by Alan Bleviss.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Brun, National Film Board of Canada and Nimbus Film Productions

results.title: Snow White and the seven dwarfs [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David D. Hand, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: This film is regarded as a milestone in filmmaking as Walt Disney’s first full-length animated feature. Adapted from Grimm’s Fairy Tales, the film is the fairytale of Snow White, the beautiful princess whose life is threatened by the jealous Queen. Snow White finds safe haven with the seven dwarfs: Doc, Happy, Grumpy, Sleepy, Sneezy, Bashful and Dopey until a mysterious old woman arrives with a poison apple. Three years in the making, this feature propagated new developments in animation, using an unprecedented amount of man-hours in the creation of realistic movement on screen. This film is imbued in bountiful humour and music and of course striking animation. Originally billed as a children’s film, “Snow White and the seven dwarfs” is a film that from the outset had the ability to appeal across age brackets.

results.title: Soldier girls, The Leader, his driver and the driver's wife, Tracking down Maggie: The Nick Broomfield Collection Vol 2
results.brief_description: Soldier girls closely follows a group of American women recruits through a gruelling six weeks of basic training, during which time, some manage and some fail to come to terms with some of the realities that recruiting brochures never mentioned. “The Leader, his driver and the driver’s wife” Award-winning documentary shows what happens when the apparently shambolic Broomfield tries to make a film about the neo-Nazi Afrikaner Resistance movement and its leader Eugene Terre Blanche. The result is both frightening and hilarious, as Broomfield lulls his subjects into portraying themselves in their true light and deflates the pompous rhetoric by refusing to take it seriously. “Tracking down Maggie” Humorous and revealing look into the political and private worlds of former British Prime Minister, Lady Margaret Thatcher, whose lack of compliance with Broomfield aids the production.
